Major_Arcs.title: Paul Bunyan and the Circus
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc follows Paul Bunyan's unexpected adventure at a circus, where he becomes involved in resolving internal conflicts and thwarting revenge plots, ultimately leading to his departure.

sub_scenes.title: Circus Arrival and Introduction
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces the circus setting and the character of Paul Bunyan as a strongman performer. It also shows the arrival of a visitor and a family at the circus.

narrative_arcs.title: Man Hears News of the Circus
Family Reacts to Giraffe at Circus

sub_scenes.title: Intervention and Revelation
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene details the man in the checkered shirt investigating sounds of trouble, intervening in a threatening situation, and revealing himself to be Paul Bunyan.

narrative_arcs.title: Pistol Threat and Revelation of Identity

sub_scenes.title: The Circus Owner's Offer
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene focuses on the aftermath of the fight, the circus owner's gratitude and his proposition for Paul Bunyan to become the circus's new strongman.

narrative_arcs.title: Gratitude and Revelation of Past Conflict

sub_scenes.title: Matto Grasso's Revenge Plot
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces Matto Grasso's envy and his plans for revenge against Paul Bunyan, first with arson.

narrative_arcs.title: Paul Bunyan's Circus Debut and Matto Grasso's Envy
Circus Tent Fire and Paul Bunyan's Swift Action

sub_scenes.title: The Ape Incident
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene details Matto Grasso's second revenge plan involving releasing an ape, and Paul Bunyan's intervention again.

narrative_arcs.title: Matto Grasso's Frustration and a New Scheme
The Ape's Release and Paul's Intervention

sub_scenes.title: Chase and Failed Attempts to Capture
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene focuses on the chase of the ape releaser within the circus arena and his comical attempts to evade capture.

narrative_arcs.title: Entering the Arena and a New Plan
The Hat Trick and Continued Escape

sub_scenes.title: Unexpected Fight Spectacle
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts an unscheduled fight breaking out in the arena, becoming an unexpected entertainment for the audience.

sub_scenes.title: Departure from the Circus
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene concludes Paul Bunyan's circus adventure with him declining a job offer and deciding to return to the North Woods.

Major_Arcs.title: Marco Polo's Hi-Toun Adventure
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc follows Marco Polo's journey to Hi-Toun, his quest to find the missing Princess Lotus, and his unexpected encounter with the Ogress of Tibet.

sub_scenes.title: Ogress and the Severed Head
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene begins Marco Polo's new adventure, starting with a flashback and transitioning to a new encounter with a severed head.

narrative_arcs.title: Encounter with the Awful Ogress of Tibet

sub_scenes.title: Help from the Old Man
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene involves Marco Polo aiding an old man, receiving a sacred dagger as a gift, and directions towards Hi-Toun and Princess Lotus.

narrative_arcs.title: Gratitude and Guidance from the Old Man

sub_scenes.title: Arrival at Mourning Hi-Toun
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Marco Polo's arrival at Hi-Toun and his discovery of the city's mourning state due to the King's grief.

sub_scenes.title: The King's Plea for Princess Lotus
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene focuses on Marco Polo meeting the King of Hi-Toun and learning about the disappearance of Princess Lotus, leading to his offer to help.

narrative_arcs.title: The King's Grief Over Daughter Lotus's Disappearance

sub_scenes.title: Deception at the Witch's Castle
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene narrates Marco Polo's encounter with a woman in distress, leading him to a castle that turns out to be a trap by the Ogress of Tibet.

narrative_arcs.title: Encounter with a Starving Woman and the Witch's Castle
Entering the Mysterious Castle and Meeting the 'Children'

sub_scenes.title: Ogress's True Form and Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene details the revelation of the old woman as the Ogress of Tibet and the subsequent confrontation, setting up a fight.

narrative_arcs.title: Imprisonment as a 'Guest' and Ogress Revelation
Confrontation with Tusked Mice and Ogress's Claws

sub_scenes.title: Escape with Magic Knife and Return
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene oddly interjects with a different narrative about escape using a magic knife, which seems misplaced in the Marco Polo narrative. It concludes with the princess's return and the young man's reward.

narrative_arcs.title: The Unexpected Attack and Its Success
Dungeon Escape and Journey to Father

Major_Arcs.title: The Treasure of Agra and Betrayal
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc tells a tale of buried treasure, betrayal, and revenge set in a British penal colony and later in England.

sub_scenes.title: Prologue and Penal Colony
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene sets the stage with a Treasure Keeper's prologue and introduces the setting in a British penal colony.

narrative_arcs.title: Penal Colony Routine and Officer's Request

sub_scenes.title: The Treasure Deal
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene describes the prisoner's desperate plea to Captain Brooking and the subsequent deal made for treasure in exchange for escape.

sub_scenes.title: Betrayal and Revenge
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene focuses on the prisoner's realization of betrayal, his vow for revenge, and his long wait for freedom to enact it.

narrative_arcs.title: Realization of Betrayal and Vow of Revenge
Years Later - Freedom and Undying Vengeance

sub_scenes.title: Confrontation and Murder
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene details Jordan's pursuit of Brooking, their confrontation, Brooking's deceptive invitation, and the subsequent murder in the attic.

sub_scenes.title: Police Investigation and Moral Conclusion
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene concludes the treasure story with the police investigation of the murder and a moral reflection on the evils of treasure.

Major_Arcs.title: The Haunted Matthews Estate
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc tells a supernatural tale of a haunted estate, an investigation by Dr. Styx, and the resolution of the haunting through forgiveness and brotherly love.

sub_scenes.title: Setting the Stage for Haunting
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces Dr. Styx in a threatening situation and then shifts to a courtroom setting where Vincent Matthews is sentenced for murder, setting up the context for the haunting.

sub_scenes.title: Investigation Begins
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene details the discussion about the haunted Matthews estate between Mr. Northrup and Dr. Styx, and Mr. Northrup's arrival at the estate.

narrative_arcs.title: Discussion about Matthews' Estate and Haunting

sub_scenes.title: Confrontation with the Ghost
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Mr. Northrup ignoring warnings, entering the house, and his immediate confrontation with Vincent Matthews' ghost, leading to a physical struggle.

narrative_arcs.title: Ignoring Alvin's Warning and Entering the House

sub_scenes.title: Salvation through Forgiveness and Love
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene focuses on the dialogue between Mr. Northrup and the ghost, leading to the revelation of salvation through forgiveness and brotherly love, culminating in Rosalind's appearance and forgiveness.

narrative_arcs.title: Seeking Guidance and Receiving Advice on Salvation
Revelation of Rosalind as the Key to Salvation
Forced Confrontation and Accusation of Cowardice
Physical Restraint and Assertion of Superior Strength
Accusation and Identification of the Destroyer
Request for a Favor: Permitting Rest
Acceptance of Brotherly Love and Release
Vincent's Remorse and Rosalind's Ultimate Forgiveness

Major_Arcs.title: Henry Hudson's Ill-Fated Voyage
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc recounts Henry Hudson's persistent but ultimately tragic quest for the Northwest Passage, detailing his voyages, crew discontent, and the mutiny that sealed his fate.

sub_scenes.title: Hudson's Commission and Second Voyage Setup
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces the historical context of Henry Hudson and sets up his second voyage commissioned by the Dutch East India Company.

narrative_arcs.title: The Mysterious Fate of Henry Hudson

sub_scenes.title: Voyage and Growing Discontent
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene follows the initial stages of Hudson's voyage, the crew's rising discontent, and their false hope upon entering the Hudson River.

narrative_arcs.title: Growing Discontent and Demand to Turn South
Entering the Hudson River and False Hope
Hudson's Resignation and Decision to Return Home

sub_scenes.title: Arctic Voyage and Mutiny
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Hudson's subsequent voyage to the Arctic, the ship getting trapped in ice, and the eventual mutiny by the crew.

narrative_arcs.title: Hudson's Second Expedition and Icy Route
Resumption of Voyage and Crew's Grievances

Major_Arcs.title: Arabian Knight and the Tartar Rescue
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc follows the Arabian Knight, Hassan, on a mission to rescue a kidnapped woman from Tartar horsemen, culminating in a trial by combat and a surprising resolution.

sub_scenes.title: The Chase and Mission Assignment
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces the Arabian Knight in a chase scene and then shifts to the Caliph assigning him a mission to rescue a kidnapped woman.

narrative_arcs.title: The Arabian Knight Introduction and Chase
Summoned by the Caliph and The Mission Briefing

sub_scenes.title: Journey and Oasis Encounters
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene details Hassan setting off on his mission, arriving at a deserted oasis, and encountering a traveler who warns him of danger.

narrative_arcs.title: The Deserted Oasis and Tracking the Tartars
Encounter and Warning from a Traveler
Revealing the Rescue and Parting Ways

sub_scenes.title: Infiltration and Capture
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene focuses on Hassan reaching the Tartar camp, taking down a sentry, infiltrating the camp in disguise, and gathering information, but ultimately getting captured.

sub_scenes.title: Trial by Combat and Resolution
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene culminates in the trial by combat, where Hassan, unarmed, faces three Tartar fighters and ultimately wins, leading to Kurgan honoring his word and granting safe passage.

narrative_arcs.title: Kurgan's Recognition and Grant of Safe Passage

sub_scenes.title: Farewell and Journey's End Romance
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene concludes the Arabian Knight's adventure with a noble farewell from Kurgan and a budding romance between Hassan and the rescued woman.
